Articles.Content: Why i cant fill tank only with only fuel or just any substance ? hmmm. My idea is to make tanks more flexible. Let we say the tank got capacity of 10000 liters. So what i can do is fill it with 10000 liquid fuel or oxydiser or 50/50 or use it for monopropelant. Let we say if you use one type of fill you got full space 10000 but if you use two or tree walls inside your capacity go down by 1% (for example). so you use tank for just fuel ok 10000 liters. 50/50 ok you got 9900 liters for fuel and oxydiser (4950 each). So why not use extra grid in tank and take some monopropelant with you. 3 grids take 2% and you got capacity of 9800 so you fill it with 4800 (each) fuel and oxy and extra 200 for monopropelant. This idea not support an ore for them still shoud be separate tanks :confused:.

Well, realistically, different type of liquids require different tanks. It's not the same to pump monoprop or whatever liquid fuel is than liquid oxygen.
Unrealistically, yeah, something like the firespitter fuel switch or the interstellar fuel switch (small mods that do precisely that) would be great ingame, even if it adjusts the dry weight of the tank to compensate for the different "pumps". It would also reduce the parts clutter in the VAB/SPH

The Modular Fuel Tanks mod does just this, but I do agree it should be stock. This is what I expect changing tanks to be like on the inside, with MP, OX, and LF:


[img]http://i.imgur.com/j1LO4u2.jpg[/img]
Whee for terrible drawings! Edited November 22, 2015 by legoclone09
Why not just choose smaller tanks and add them in the ratio of different fuels you want? In all my 1000 hours of playing KSP, I never ran into a problem that this would solve.

You must not use the NERV engines then. The biggest thing missing is Liquid Fuel tanks in large sizes. This Moho craft could have been significantly smaller if I could have filled that Oxidizer space with Liquid Fuel instead. However, I was forced to spend extra cost on oversized tanks so I could take empty space to Moho. But hey, at least we have 6 kinds of jet engines, only 2 of which can go to space.
